oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville Symphony Orchestra, Sixth Season, 1926 January 17
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A concert program of the Nashville Symphony Orchestra’s Sixth Season (1925-26), the third concert with F. Arthur Henkel, Conductor, performed at Memorial Auditorium, January 17th, 1926. Includes an insert announcing an upcoming concert featuring the Minneapolis Symphony Orchestra, with Henri Verbrugghen, Conductor. Includes several local advertisers: The Frank School of Music; Gullom & Ghertner Company; L.A. Bauman Company; B.H. Stief Jewelry; Ward-Belmont Conservatory of Music; Claude P. Street Piano Company; and others. Forms part of the Nashville Symphony Orchestra Collection. 1 program.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Verbrugghen, Henri; Henkel, Frederick Arthur, 1880-

Nashville Symphony; Minneapolis Symphony Orchestra; Frank School of Music (Nashville, Tenn.); Gullom & Ghertner Company (Nashville, Tenn.); L.A. Bauman Company (Nashville, Tenn.); Ward-Belmont Conservatory of Music (Nashville, Tenn.); Claude P. Street Piano Company (Nashville, Tenn.)
